title: [K-12] Mathematics Course Integrating Backward Design and Lateral Thinking for Creative Thinking Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and practical experience in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, focusing on enhancing creative problem-solving skills for learners with diverse cognitive styles (dependent/independent)

learning_goals: Over six months, learners apply backward design (goal setting → assessment criteria → activity design) and lateral thinking to 10 real-world math problems (3 optimization, 3 puzzles, 4 applied problems) provided weekly, achieving ≥70% on a teacher rubric (40% problem-solving process, 30% creativity, 30% accuracy) in a two-page report.

Over 1–6 months, learners apply a five-stage creative problem-solving process (problem decomposition → perspective shift → idea generation → verification → optimization) to ≥7 of 10 complex middle school math problems (e.g., systems of equations + geometry) provided biweekly, achieving an average of ≥2/3 points on a peer rubric (originality, logic, completeness).
Understand peers' diverse thinking styles and develop integrative approaches through team-based activities

resources: Digital collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
